chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah J. COLEMAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with the victim, J.S.M., DOB: 05-30-2002.

Undergo any sex offender treatment as required.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Comply with Sex Offender Registry.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, on count 1 only, commencing immediately.

Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held on 09-28-2016.
Copy of Transrcipt mailed to Registar at Dodge Correctional Institution.
Notice of Case Status Change from DOC indicating defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to time served effective 09-28-2016

COMPETENCY HEARING - 
The parties have reviewed the report of Jenna Niess.  There are no additions or corrections from either party.
Attorney Kavanaugh believes that the defendant is competent to proceed in these matters.
The Court asks the defendant if he is competent and the defendant answers "he doesn't know."  Based on this response, the Court will hear testimony from the doctor.
Testimony presented.
Based on the findings in the report and the doctors testimony today, the Court finds the defendant competent to proceed in these matters.

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION OF PROBATION (CONTINUED FROM 05-24-16) - 
On count 1, 3rd degree sexual assault, the defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for a total of nine (9) years.  That is four (4) years initial confinement followed by five (5) years extended supervision.
The defendant has credit for 480 days per the court.
On count 3, battery, the defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for six (6) months, time already served.
Defendant has credit for 480 days per the court.
The Court finds the defendant not eligible for either the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
Conditions of extended supervision:
1) AODA assessment and follow through;
2) Undergo mental health assessment and follow through;
3) Pay costs.
4) pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC;
5) maintain absolute sobriety;
6) maintain fulltime employment, schooling, combination;
7) register as a sexual offender.
